doctitle.textblock: Information Collection Under OMB Review: Application for Amounts on Deposit for Deceased Veterans, VA Form 21-6898

action.textblock: The Department of Veterans Affairs has submitted to OMB the following proposal for the collection of information under the provisions of the Paperwork Reduction Act (44 U.S.C. chapter 35). This document lists the following information: (1) The title of the information collection, and the Department form number(s), if applicable; (2) a description of the need and its use; (3) who will be required or asked to respond; (4) an estimate of the total annual reporting hours, and recordkeeping burden, if applicable; (5) the estimated average burden hours per respondent; (6) the frequency of response; and (7) an estimated number of respondents.

address.textblock: Copies of the proposed information collection and supporting documents may be obtained from Janet G. Byers, Veterans Benefits Administration (20A5), Department of Veterans Affairs, 810 Vermont Avenue, NW., Washington, DC 20420 (202) 233-3021.

Comments and questions about the items on the list should be directed to VA's OMB Desk Officer, Joseph Lackey, NEOB, room 3002, Washington, DC 20503, (202) 395-7316. Do not send requests for benefits to this address.

date.textblock: Comments on the information collection should be directed to the OMB Desk Officer within 30 days of this notice.

signjob.textblock: 1. Application for Amounts on Deposit for Deceased Veterans, VA Form 21-6898

2. The form is used to gather the necessary information to determine who is the proper payee of gratuitous benefits deposited by VA into the Personal Funds of Patients for a veteran during hospitalization and due the veteran at the date of his or her death.
